cardDescription: General information about the mitzvah of Ma'aser Kesafim

content.title: What is Ma'aser Kesafim?
content.body: Ma'aser Kesafim is an ancient custom practiced by the Jewish people, to set aside a tenth of their profits for charity. Although it is not a Torah obligation, many treat it as a complete obligation.

content.title: And what is Chomesh?
content.body: Some have the custom of setting aside a fifth (20%) of their income, which is a measure of piety based on the words of the Sages: 'One who spends generously should not spend more than a fifth'.

content.title: From what is it separated?
content.body: It is important to note that the separation is made from the net profit, after deducting necessary expenses and the cost of living.
